p: The anti-SARS-CoV-2 activity was also investigated for the compounds extracted from Artemisia Annua. Among these, artemisinin ( Figure 8) the most abundant active component, is an antimalarial agent showing a promising broad-spectrum antiviral activity [ 91, 92]. In-silico approaches helped to understand the possible mechanism of artemisinin to prevent the interaction between S protein and ACE2 receptor, due to its ability to bind Lys353 and Lys31 hotspot binding region [ 93].
